comment.author: 23150614@N06
comment._content: The cruiser Hai Chi ("Flag of the Sea") earned in 1911 the distinction of being the first Chinese war boat ever to visit the West when she steamed as near as possible to the Coronation of King George V, discharged a cargo of Chinese emissaries in gorgeous silken robes. Built in 1897 source : www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,753799-1,00.html New York Times, September 13, 1911, Wednesday The Chinese cruiser Hai-Chi, which arrived here Monday, was visited by hundreds yesterday. The Chinese residents of New York flocked to Seventy-ninth Street and the North River, and chartered every boat in sight to get on board the only vessel flying the flag of their country that has ever been in American waters. source : query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9802E0D91531E233A...

comment.author: 41675580@N08
comment._content: Nice old shot of a moment in time, lovely to see pictures like this.

comment.author: 50270566@N07
comment._content: From the Qing Navy;  the Double 10 revolution was less than a month away.
